title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, allegedly posed as a doctor and performed unauthorized cosmetic surgery in an Allston apartment.
Wang faces multiple charges, including assault, kidnapping, and unauthorized practice of medicine, DA Kevin Hayden's office reports.
The victim suffered permanent damage after Wang used non-FDA-approved fillers and prevented her from leaving mid-procedure.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda was struck by an MBTA train near Plymouth St. in Abington around 8 p.m. Sunday.
The car broke down on the tracks; the 35-year-old driver exited the vehicle before the collision.
There were no casualties or injuries reported in the incident, according to Transit Police.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman walking on Route 28 in Wareham was hit and killed by a car due to snowy sidewalks.
The incident occurred around 8:40 p.m.; both the pedestrian and a male companion were initially struck by a truck's mirror.
The Volvo's driver remained on scene and stated the crash was unavoidable due to oncoming traffic; an investigation is ongoing.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester police officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to four years in prison for child pornography charge.
Aiello pleaded guilty in October 2025 to receiving child pornography; investigated after encrypted files found on devices.
Aiello's devices contained over 200 files of child sexual abuse material, found during police search in April 2025.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven people are presumed dead after the Gloucester-based fishing boat Lily Jean sank, confirmed by the U.S. Coast Guard.
The Coast Guard and National Transportation Safety Board will jointly investigate the incident, expected to take several months.
The community mourns the loss, with officials emphasizing the crew were 'the finest kind' dedicated to the sea.

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Bill Belichick did not receive enough votes for first-ballot induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame 2026.
93% of over 450 Boston.com readers considered Belichick's exclusion from the Hall of Fame a snub.
Readers cited Belichick's coaching success and controversies, including Patriots-era scandals, in their opinions on his Hall of Fame candidacy.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: New England Patriots prepare for their 12th Super Bowl appearance, stirring memories of past championship wins.
Iconic moments include Adam Vinatieri's 2002 game-winning field goal and Malcolm Butler's interception against the Seahawks.
Fans invited to share memorable Patriots Super Bowl experiences, both personal traditions and unforgettable game highlights.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, will run her first Boston Marathon to celebrate personal resilience and perseverance.
Lang, diagnosed with antiphospholipid syndrome in 2025, uses her journey to advocate for stroke and heart disease awareness.
She fundraises for Tedy's Team, promoting research and outreach for heart health and stroke prevention and education.

title: Once a patient, now a runner: She’s running for Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Molly Kokoski, 26, is running the Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital.
Kokoski, diagnosed with ulcerative colitis, credits the hospital for saving her life and supporting her long-term care.
Despite challenges from wearing an ostomy bag, Kokoski aims to show it doesn't limit her abilities.

title: Saks OFF 5th to close Massachusetts stores
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Saks OFF 5th to close its stores in Assembly Row, Somerville and Wrentham as Saks Global files for bankruptcy.
Saks Global plans to close most Saks OFF 5th locations, focusing on luxury retail and full-price operations instead.
The closures follow Saks Global's $1.75 billion financing arrangement as part of its bankruptcy restructuring effort.
